p: The purified and fractionated sample 3 of an iCalB catalyzed synthesis reaction in a DES, based on lignocellulosic sugars, with FAMEs, was investigated with one and two-dimensional 1H and 13C NMR spectra. Glucose was identified through one clear major carbohydrate system, starting from the anomeric protons of the 1H COZY and 13C HMBC spectra. Cross peaks between the two protons attached at the glucosesâ€˜ C6 at 4.23 and 4.35 ppm with the lipid carbonyl at 174.03 ppm in the 1H 13C HMBC indicates, that glucose was acylated (Table 2). Due to some impurities and the used mixture of fatty acid methyl esters, it was not possible to clearly identify which FAME is connected to the glucose molecule.
